intro: Othonna euphorbioides subsp. jarmilae, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry plant, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red, fleshy berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Asteraceae family.
